snippet: A conflict over a recent chemical spill at a factory has drawn attention to growing problems with environmental degradation and officials’ reluctance to take on polluters.
abstract: Conflict over the Changzhi chemical spill, which occurred on December 31, 2012, has drawn attention to growing problems with water use and pollution in northern China; region, which has suffered from a drought for decades, is grappling with how industrial companies should operate along rivers.

byline.contributor: Amy Qin and Patrick Zuo contributed research from Handan and Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A conflict over a recent chemical spill at a factory has drawn attention to growing problems with environmental degradation and officials’ reluctance to take on polluters.

headline.seo: Spill in China Lays Bare Environmental Concerns
headline.main: Spill in China Underlines Environmental Concerns
